Its discovery highlights the dynamic nature of our solar system and the ongoing efforts in planetary defense.

He argues that multi-year degrees risk obsolescence before completion and should only be pursued by those genuinely obsessed with their field. Instead, he advocates learning from life, developing emotional intelligence, and embracing adaptability. Tarifi suggests that passion, not credentials, is the key to staying ahead in a world where technology evolves rapidly.

Why is Joel Embiid out vs Orlando Magic? Latest update on 76ers star’s injury
description: Joel Embiid will sit out Monday's game against the Orlando Magic due to "injury management" for his left knee, a decision made to avoid risks on a back-to-back.  His playing time has been limited this season, and he expressed frustration with the short stints. Four other Sixers players are also sidelined with various injuries.

No SIR in Assam? Electoral rolls to be announced separately; EC explains why
description: The Election Commission will conduct a separate Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Assam due to unique legal provisions. Meanwhile, the second phase of SIR will cover 12 states and UTs, aiming to ensure accurate voter lists before upcoming polls.

Big relief: H-4 visa holders keep right to work in US - will Trump change it?
description: The US Supreme Court has ended a decade-long legal fight, allowing H-4 visa holders, primarily spouses of H-1B workers, to continue working. This decision upholds employment authorization for those facing green card backlogs.

Surya’s form a concern? Gambhir breaks silence: 'We’ve made a decision'
description: Head coach Gautam Gambhir backs T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav despite recent batting dips, emphasizing an ultra-aggressive team philosophy where failures are accepted. Gambhir prioritizes a fearless brand of cricket over individual scores, highlighting Suryakumar's leadership and a dressing room culture built on trust and freedom from the fear of losing.

IND vs AUS: 'Stop!' India selectors given warning on Rohit and Virat selection
description: Former captain Krishnamachari Srikkanth urged the BCCI selectors to back Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for the 2027 World Cup, emphasizing their fitness and recent performances. He advised clear communication, assuring the veterans of their importance and encouraging them to focus on staying fit to lead India to victory.

title: Priyamani says being paid less than male co-stars doesn’t bother her: ‘I know my market value…’
Whose gold is it? Wife’s Rs 1.65cr jewellery seized; husband moves ITAT & wins - explained
description: The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal ruled in favor of a taxpayer, stating that gold jewelry seized during a search could not be treated as unexplained investment in his hands. The Tribunal noted that the same assets were already declared and accepted in his wife's tax assessment, making a separate addition legally baseless.

'Attack' on CJI: Why SC refused to act against accused lawyer; will set up norms
description: The Supreme Court acknowledged shoe-hurling as contempt but declined action against the lawyer, citing potential glorification. The SCBA president criticized this, deeming it a joke on the institution. The apex court will instead issue guidelines on social media conduct and the glorification of such incidents.

Asia Cup handshake row: J&K CM bats for 'spirit of the game' - 'why not?'
description: Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah expressed disappointment that the Indian cricket team did not shake hands with Pakistan's Salman Ali Agha's side during the Asia Cup. He emphasized playing in the spirit of the game and advocated for resuming bilateral cricket ties between the two nations.

UP's Mustafabad to be renamed? What CM Yogi said
description: In a move to honor cultural heritage, Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath declared the renaming of Mustafabad village in Lakhimpur Kheri to 'Kabirdham'. This decision seeks to revive the legacy of Sant Kabir, particularly underscoring the village's historical significance regardless of its current demographics. Adityanath's announcement aligns with other similar renaming efforts aimed at restoring the region's cultural roots.

Bihar 2025: It’s pronounced ‘welfare’, not ‘freebies’
iPhones boom, Trump sanctions impact: Electronics to become 2nd-most exported
description: India's electronics exports are surging, driven by booming iPhone production, and are projected to become the second-largest export category. This rise coincides with a potential decline in oil exports due to US sanctions on Russian crude, impacting refiners' purchases and eliminating price advantages.

title: Major update on Tom Aspinall following shocking eye poke spot at UFC 321
description: UFC 321's main event concluded controversially when Tom Aspinall was accidentally eye-poked by Ciryl Gane, rendering him unable to continue. Aspinall later shared an update, expressing significant concern about his eye injury, stating it's scarier than his previous knee injury. He has returned to England for further medical evaluation.

title: Shreyas Iyer still in ICU after dangerously low body vitals, internal bleeding
description: Indian cricketer Shreyas Iyer is currently in the ICU of a Sydney hospital following a serious fall during the third ODI against Australia. Reports indicate he experienced dangerously low body vitals post-incident and was immediately hospitalized in a critical, life-threatening condition. His recovery is ongoing.

title: 'Flying Chernobyl': Russia now has nuclear-powered missile; what is Burevestnik?
description: Russia successfully tested its nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile, a weapon President Putin claims can "pierce any defence shield." The test, conducted alongside a nuclear drill, signals Moscow's defiance against Western pressure over Ukraine. Putin announced the country will now move towards deploying the "invincible" missile, which reportedly traveled 14,000 kilometers.

title: Hack of the day: Flight delayed or cancelled? Get refund or compensation
description: Stranded due to flight disruptions in India? You're entitled to rights! Airlines must provide meals, refreshments, and even hotel stays for significant delays. For cancellations, expect refunds or rebooking options. Know your entitlements under the Passenger Charter and how to file a complaint via AirSewa to claim compensation up to ₹10,000.

title: Ghee & wine: Inside Delhi woman's 'fiery' plot to kill boyfriend; what was the motive?
description: A live-in relationship turned deadly as a 21-year-old woman, her ex-boyfriend, and his friend allegedly murdered her partner, a UPSC aspirant, in Delhi. They staged the crime as a fire incident to conceal the murder, driven by the victim's alleged possession of objectionable content. The trio has been arrested.

title: Kolkata: Mob of 50 led by auto driver storms flat, assaults customs officer, wife
description: A customs inspector and his wife were brutally assaulted in their Kolkata home by a mob of 50, led by an auto driver, after a minor traffic altercation. Police, reportedly busy with Kali Puja immersions, arrived late, allowing most attackers to escape. Arrested individuals were quickly granted bail, sparking resident fears.

title: Gainfully 'employed': Rajasthan Officer ‘pays salaries’ to wife for fake jobs
description: Jaipur's anti-corruption bureau has filed a case against a senior IT department officer, Pradhyuman Dixit, for allegedly orchestrating illegal salary payments to his wife, Poonam Dixit, through two private firms. Over Rs 30 lakh was deposited into her accounts between 2019 and 2020, despite her never working for the companies. Authorities suspect these payments were bribes for IT contract favors.

title: Joe Alwyn slammed as old video with Taylor Swift goes viral amid Kelce praise
description: Taylor Swift's upcoming wedding to Travis Kelce has fans buzzing, especially after a resurfaced clip from 2022 showing her with ex Joe Alwyn sparked outrage.  Fans criticized Alwyn's apparent rush to avoid paparazzi, contrasting it with Kelce's public support for Swift's success.  The couple remains private about their wedding details.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
description: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: Lauren Kyle McDavid shapes Edmonton’s design and lifestyle culture
description: While the Oilers faced a Stanley Cup Final loss, Lauren Kyle McDavid is forging her own path in Edmonton. Her innovative Trove Living concept, blending furniture, design, and a social hub, has become a vibrant downtown destination.  Her fashion brand and community involvement further solidify her commitment to the city, mirroring Connor's ambition.
